Package org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request

Class X509ResponseMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.request.X509ResponseMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CertificateResponseMessage, ResponseMessage
    public class X509ResponseMessage
extends Object
implements CertificateResponseMessage
    A response message consisting of a single X509 or CVC Certificate. Name is nowadays slightly misleading since the class can care any type of "Certificate", for example a CV certificate.
    Version:
    $Id: X509ResponseMessage.java 28201 2018-02-07 08:33:29Z andresjakobs $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAdditionalCaCertificates​(List<Certificate> certificates)
      Adds a list of additional CA certificates to be appended to the user certificates CA certificate returned in the CMP response message caPubs field.
      void addAdditionalResponseExtraCertsCertificates​(List<Certificate> certificates)
      Adds a list of additional CA certificates to be appended to the outer PKI message signing CA in its extraCerts field).

      Create encrypts and creates signatures as needed to produce a complete response message.

      Sets preferred digest algorithm for the response message, if applicable.
      void setProtectionParamsFromRequest​(RequestMessage reqMsg)
      For some types of requests, the protection used depends on parameters from the request, for example password based protection where algorithms, keyId etc is the same in the response as in the request

      void setRequestType​(int reqtype)

      • create

        public boolean create()
        Create encrypts and creates signatures as needed to produce a complete response message. If needed setSignKeyInfo must be called before this method. After this is called the response message can be retrieved with getResponseMessage();
        Specified by:
        create in interface ResponseMessage
        Returns:
        True if signature/encryption was successful, false if it failed, request should not be sent back i failed.
        See Also:
        setSignKeyInfo(java.util.Collection<java.security.cert.Certificate>, java.security.PrivateKey, java.lang.String)

      • requireSignKeyInfo

        public boolean requireSignKeyInfo()
        indicates if this message needs recipients public and private key to sign. If this returns true, setSignKeyInfo() should be called.
        Specified by:
        requireSignKeyInfo in interface ResponseMessage
        Returns:
        True if public and private key is needed.

      • setSignKeyInfo

        public void setSignKeyInfo​(Collection<Certificate> certs,
                           PrivateKey key,
                           String provider)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseMessage
        Sets the public and private key needed to sign the message. Must be set if requireSignKeyInfo() returns true.
        Specified by:
        setSignKeyInfo in interface ResponseMessage
        Parameters:
        certs - certificate containing the public key.
        key - private key.
        provider - the provider to use, if the private key is on a HSM you must use a special provider. If null is given, the default BC provider is used.
        See Also:
        ResponseMessage.requireSignKeyInfo()

      • setPreferredDigestAlg

        public void setPreferredDigestAlg​(String digest)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseMessage
        Sets preferred digest algorithm for the response message, if applicable. If this is not called, a default is used.
        Specified by:
        setPreferredDigestAlg in interface ResponseMessage
        Parameters:
        digest - String oid of digest algorithm ex CMSSignedDataGenerator.SHA1, SHA256 etc

      • setRequestType

        public void setRequestType​(int reqtype)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseMessage
        Sometimes (CMP) the response identifier sent depends on which request identifier was used, even if the messages themselves are the same mesages.
        Specified by:
        setRequestType in interface ResponseMessage
        Parameters:
        reqtype - which type of request message this response is in response to

      • setRequestId

        public void setRequestId​(int reqid)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseMessage
        For some types of request-responses there is a need for a requetsId to match the request and the response together.
        Specified by:
        setRequestId in interface ResponseMessage
        Parameters:
        reqid - the id from the request matching to this response

      • setProtectionParamsFromRequest

        public void setProtectionParamsFromRequest​(RequestMessage reqMsg)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseMessage
        For some types of requests, the protection used depends on parameters from the request, for example password based protection where algorithms, keyId etc is the same in the response as in the request
        Specified by:
        setProtectionParamsFromRequest in interface ResponseMessage
        Parameters:
        reqMsg - the request from where to pick protection parameters
